Getting Started with Widgets Toolbox

What is Widgets Toolbox?

Widgets Toolbox provides a package of MATLAB objects that implement higher level components to use as building blocks for programmatic graphical user interface elements placed within a MATLAB figure window.
Example components are:
  • A file selection control, consisting of a label, edit field, and browse button
  • A listbox control combined with a label and a set of buttons for managing the list composition and ordering
  • A tree control providing advanced functionalities like drag and drop, and checkbox nodes
  • Superclasses for a whole application, to provide and manage saving and loading session state to and from a file
  • A logger, especially useful for complex or deployed apps, that will store application events/data (of a configurable severity level) to a log file and display them in the command window

Who should use Widgets Toolbox?

Widgets Toolbox is most applicable to users who are writing hand code to develop complex, modular applications with hand code using object-oriented programming in MATLAB. Complex applications may be classified as having a number of different views, or components that require significant interactive functionality. They should be robust to user workflows. These applications may be used by workgroups to make critical design or business decisions, and often require anywhere from a few weeks to many months of development effort. However, this toolbox does not support web graphics (uifigure containers).
If you are new to MATLAB or to building MATLAB applications, or if you are building a simple or proof-of-concept application, it is recommended you review MATLAB's App Designer and the documentation on Differences Between App Designer and GUIDE.

Layout Management

An important aspect of a complex application is layout management. It is recommended that you consider also using GUI Layout Toolbox as a companion to Widgets Toolbox. GUI Layout Toolbox provides a framework to manage positioning and resizing of complex user interface layouts.

Limitations

These components are intended to be used with or added to a traditional MATLAB figure programmatically. However, they may also be added programmatically to a GUIDE-generated app, but not within the graphical GUIDE editor. The components do not support the web graphics used by AppDesigner and uifigure containers.

Installation

Widgets Toolbox is provided as a MATLAB toolbox file (.mltbx). It is strongly recommended that you install Widgets Toolbox in this way, in order to ensure the MATLAB and Java files are added to your path properly. If you install by including the folder on your MATLAB path, you must ensure that the Java .jar files in the Toolbox are added to your dynamic or static Java path for your MATLAB session.
For instructions on installing and uninstalling MATLAB toolbox files, see the section on managing toolboxes in the MATLAB documentation.
If you like this toolbox, please help others to find it by leaving a rating and comment on the MATLAB Central File Exchange.
